messages.content:
You are a professional HR expert, helping me write a bio that will help me get contracts to be a trainer for programs that train people in coding no code applications for early entrepreneurs. I have my bio below. I have been building robots and apps and no code solutions for my organization Bloom.pm using SOFTR, softer and Airtable and other no code and code-based frameworks make and Xavier and I have been training people and design, thinking and coming up with the simplest way to validate ideas using no code and code-based solutions to explore yourself your world. Your projects and I would like to update the following bio to include this information. I have been a part of robotics, redefined building robots, and Blue. I used to build a lot of automations using air table, and I have started way way that AI to explore AI and drawing robots, I have built tools that let us listen to Karam and more so if you have any idea that you would like to test explore, please come to my workshop and the bio needs to help me seem like an expert that mean thank you so much and please update the following bio
Come up a step-by-step plan to include the above information. Ask ask three additional questions they get very specific details the bio should only be two paragraphs long max and make a sound professional something that would work for Dubai in the UAE and you have a plan and have asked me the questions proceeded to update the bio and give me  three different versions. 

Bilal is a champion of wellbeing in the workplace. He received the Compassionate Leaders Fellowship USA/India with H.H. The Dalai Lama from 2019-2022, and he is perpetually seeking truth in the world.

To craft an effective and professional bio that incorporates your extensive experience in coding, no-code applications, robotics, and AI, and resonates with the business culture in Dubai, UAE, I will follow these steps:

1. **Gather Additional Information:**
   - **Experience with No-Code Tools:** Could you elaborate on any specific projects or achievements using SOFTR, Airtable, or other no-code tools at Bloom.pm?
   - **Training Experience:** Can you provide details about the training programs you've led, such as the number of participants, their outcomes, or any notable success stories?
   - **Innovative Projects:** Regarding your work with AI, robotics, and drawing robots, could you share any significant projects or innovations that had a substantial impact?

2. **Drafting the Bio:**
   - **First Paragraph:** This will focus on your technical skills and achievements, particularly in robotics, app development, and no-code solutions, emphasizing your role at Bloom.pm.
   - **Second Paragraph:** This will highlight your training expertise, including your experience in design thinking and validating ideas, along with your involvement in innovative AI projects and community engagement.

3. **Create Three Versions:**
   - Each version will have a slightly different tone and focus: one more on technical expertise, another on training and leadership abilities, and the third on innovation and community impact.

After receiving your responses to the questions, I'll proceed with updating the bio.

For the no-code tools I've used, I've used Softer, which allows you to connect Google Sheets and Airtable to a front-end. I've also used the Airtable front-end builder, which is good for behind-the-scenes work. I've used MiniExtensions, which also allows you to use Airtable to update a database visually. I've used Make.com and Zapier to create automations that run JavaScript in the cloud to allow us to do some processing on forms and give people some updates. One of the earliest versions of the assessment tool for Bloom that helped people identify their growth areas was actually using just a script that would take Airtable data and then populate an email with values in a real-time process, so that people could actually get results immediately, and that was really cool. The first paragraph will focus on my skills and achievements, emphasizing my role at Bloom. Great. Training experience. I am also a trainer. I have been a facilitator and a convener and a community builder for many years, including at gemcee.org, where we were hosting different technical and non-technical workshops. I love hosting and designing and facilitating courses. People seem to like my courses and my talks. I'm a public speaker as well, and all of my talks are highly informative.
Yeah, so I’ve worked in Lebanon since 2016 and my work explore personal development and positive impact in the world and in terms of the positive positive impact I’m not sure we’ve trained 100 and00s of entrepreneurs in Lebanon and in the Middle East

Thank you for providing these detailed insights. Based on your input, I will craft three versions of your bio, each tailored to highlight different aspects of your professional expertise and experiences.

### Version 1: Technical Expertise Focus

Bilal is a distinguished expert in the realm of no-code solutions and automation, pioneering innovative tools at Bloom.pm. Leveraging platforms like SOFTR, Airtable, MiniExtensions, Make.com, and Zapier, he has skillfully connected databases to dynamic front-ends, and automated complex processes, including a groundbreaking real-time assessment tool. This tool, ingeniously integrating Airtable data with email updates, revolutionized immediate feedback for clients. As a vibrant trainer and speaker since 2016, Bilal has inspired hundreds of entrepreneurs across Lebanon and the Middle East, imparting skills in technical and non-technical areas through his engaging workshops at gemcee.org. His commitment to personal development and generating positive impact is evident in every endeavor.

### Version 2: Training and Leadership Abilities Focus

Bilal, a beacon of knowledge and leadership in training and development, has been instrumental in shaping the entrepreneurial landscape in Lebanon and the Middle East since 2016. At Bloom.pm, he expertly utilized no-code tools like SOFTR, Airtable, and Make.com, to create user-friendly, efficient solutions, enhancing business processes and client experiences. His adept use of Airtable and MiniExtensions for visually updating databases highlights his innovative approach. As a seasoned public speaker and facilitator, Bilal has convened numerous impactful workshops at gemcee.org, covering a wide spectrum of topics, from technical skills to personal development. His courses, known for their informative nature and engaging delivery, have reached hundreds, fostering a community of informed, growth-oriented entrepreneurs.

### Version 3: Innovation and Community Impact Focus

Bilal stands at the forefront of technological innovation and community engagement. At Bloom.pm, he has been a trailblazer in integrating no-code tools like SOFTR and Airtable with advanced automations through platforms like Make.com and Zapier. His notable creation, a real-time assessment tool using Airtable and email integrations, showcases his flair for practical yet impactful innovations. Beyond technical prowess, Bilal's role in gemcee.org as a facilitator and community builder since 2016 has been transformative. His ability to design, host, and deliver captivating workshops and talks has benefited hundreds of entrepreneurs in Lebanon and the Middle East, driving positive change and personal development in the region.

---

These versions focus on different aspects of your professional journey while maintaining a consistent thread of your expertise in no-code solutions, training capabilities, and community impact. Feel free to choose the one that aligns best with your current professional goals or to use them as a basis for further customization.

Okay, I like the third one. Can you just remove some of the words like trailblazer, make it a little bit more professional and clear without these extra superfluous words? And then maybe you can add an element about how he can help you actualize your dreams using very simple and visual no-code-plus-code tools to help you make your ideas come to life. Something like that.

Certainly! Here's a revised version of the third bio, with a more professional tone and an added emphasis on how your expertise in no-code and code tools can help others actualize their ideas:

---

Bilal is a recognized leader in technological innovation and community engagement. At Bloom.pm, his expertise in integrating no-code tools like SOFTR and Airtable with advanced automations, using platforms like Make.com and Zapier, has significantly enhanced business processes and client experiences. His development of a real-time assessment tool, utilizing Airtable data and email integrations, demonstrates his commitment to practical and impactful solutions. Beyond his technical skills, Bilal has played a vital role at gemcee.org since 2016, excelling as a facilitator and community builder. His capacity to design and deliver engaging workshops and talks has empowered hundreds of entrepreneurs in Lebanon and the Middle East, fostering growth and positive change. Bilal's approach focuses on actualizing dreams through simple, visual, and effective no-code-plus-code tools, bringing ideas to life with clarity and creativity.

---

This version maintains a focus on your professional achievements and skills while removing more expressive language for a clearer, more straightforward description. It also highlights your ability to help others realize their ideas using innovative tools.
